intro: Ilex opienensis, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display. Ilex opienensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
